subject: Travel
title: Moving Two-Ton Blocks
description: A quick win: understand Moving Two-Ton Blocks.

hook.text: Each block in the Great Pyramid weighs about 2.5 tons. There are 2.3 million of them.

buildup.text: For centuries, people assumed only supernatural forces could move that much stone.

discovery.text: Experiments showed that pouring water on sand halves the friction. Blocks slide easily.

twist.text: A painting in an ancient tomb actually shows workers pouring water ahead of a sledge.

climax.text: The answer was hiding in plain sight for 3,000 years. We just forgot to look.

punchline.text: The secret to moving mountains was just water.

quiz.question: What simple technique helped move the pyramid blocks?
